metadata.title: CVE-2018-1000140 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
rsyslog librelp version 1.2.14 and earlier contains a Buffer Overflowvulnerability in the checking of x509 certificates from a peer that canresult in Remote code execution. This attack appear to be exploitable aremote attacker that can connect to rsyslog and trigger a stack bufferoverflow by sending a specially crafted x509 certificate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000140` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

librelp0 - 1.2.2-2ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: librelp package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.2-2ubuntu1.1').
